intro: Lunathyrium shennongense, commonly known as the Shennongshan moonflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its blooming period occurs during the late spring to early summer, making it a unique addition to botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
